title: Calories in Sirloin Steak
meta_description: Learn calories in sirloin per 100g serving, with detailed nutrition facts on protein, fat, carbs, and tips for variations to fit your diet.
assumptions: Lean beef sirloin steak, trimmed of visible fat, cooked by grilling or broiling, no added oils or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat content, cooking method, and source; values are approximate. Check labels or use a tracker for precision.

quick_answer.text: 100g of grilled lean beef sirloin provides ~206 kcal and ~31g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in sirloin per 100g?
faqs.a: About 206 kcal for lean grilled beef sirloin.

faqs.q: What's the protein in sirloin steak?

faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain beef sirloin.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in sirloin?
faqs.a: Grilling keeps it lean; frying or adding fat increases calories by 30-50 per 100g.
Lean cuts have ~8.5g total fat per 100g, with 3.3g saturated.
